ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Guildwar
ygData.msgSnippet: A thing that is working good, charm the master of the pet, and tell him to attack his pet. When the charm worn off, the pet will still attack his master ;) ...
ygData.messageBody:
A thing that is working good, charm the master of the pet,
and tell him to attack his pet.
When the charm worn off, the pet will still attack his master ;)


-----Message d'origine-----
De : beatdropbattledrum@...
[mailto:beatdropbattledrum@...]
Envoy├® : samedi 26 ao├╗t 2000 01:33
├Ç : eqbards@egroups.com
Objet : [eqbards] Re: Guildwar


Only thing I have to give is that fear and charm both work on non-PVP
servers. But, you cannot charm a pet. Can't even do that with NPC
pets unless the owner dies.

About interrupts, remember "most" spells have a refresh period, so
you just have to time casting just right. In other words, even
though a 2.5 second cast time spell is a faster cast time then our
songs, there is still sometimes a refresh lag period that could quite
possibly equal or be longer than our 3 sec cast time. (We have
almost no refresh on the songs.)

I hope I made sense :P

~Beatdrop Battledrum
47th Bard of the Karana Server


--- In eqbards@egroups.com, John Tatsukawa <john@t...> wrote:
> My guild is having a war with a few guilds that we are aligned
with. I've
> read some bard PvP stuff in the past from this list but it never
pertained
> to me as I never participate in PvP, so I thought I'd ask for words
of
> bardly wisdom.
>
> This is all on a non-pvp server (Bertoxxulous) and I'm a level 37
bard.
>
> I did have a few questions:
> Did they nerf our ability to charm a player's pet?
> Can you charm players in the arena?
> Does our AOE fear work well?
>
> I do know that Bellows is excellent against casters, but don't
wizzies cast
> faster than bellows? Also, don't enchanters mez cast faster than
bellows?
> Right now, I mainly would be most concerned with opposing
enchanters and bards.
>
> Thanks all!
>
> Windleaf Mistsong
> 37th level Balladeer
> Clan Battlehammer
> Bertoxxulous
